result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pierre Davieon Smith Sr

Defendant Pierre Davieon Smith Sr in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko for Amanda Poznanski in court for Pierre Davieon Smith Sr.  Attorney Alexandria S Carlson for Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant has another case 21CM3800. Defense counsel requested adjournment due to family emergency. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Pierre Davieon Smith Sr in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Pierre Davieon Smith Sr.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Plea and sentencing hearing. ADA is still reviewing digital discovery that may effect negotiations. Parties requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request. Court reminds the defendant that bail conditions remain in full force and effect.  Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Pierre Davieon Smith in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense informs the court of a global offer.  Court accepts transfer of case # 21CM3800 from Branch 1, Judge Davila.  Court scheduled a plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-05-2022

Defendant Pierre Davieon Smith in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 14 pages) commencing 05-10-2022 by KATHERINE M. NELSON.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Pierre Davieon Smith in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective D. Gaglione.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

22RM023995  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
5/4/2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Pierre Davieon Smith in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Pierre Davieon Smith in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pierre Davieon Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
